channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: "这在曼彻斯特有点不寻常"在马萨诸塞州的海岸边，一栋现代风格的住宅正以 900 万美元的价格在市场上出售。
item.description:
“It’s a little unusual for the Manchester scene.” On the Massachusetts coast, a contemporary home perched high above the water is coming on the market for $9 million. https://t.co/fFvwkUTMrX? https://t.co/fFvwkUTMrX?

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 众议院立法者预计将于周五就 1.2 万亿美元的一揽子支出法案进行投票，然后将该法案送交参议院，国会将努力在午夜截止日期前敲定 9 月份的联邦拨款。
item.description:
House lawmakers are expected to vote Friday on a $1.2 trillion package of spending bills and then send the measure to the Senate, as Congress works to finalize federal funding through September by a midnight deadline https://t.co/aRSKOgUmJd https://t.co/aRSKOgUmJd

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelensky）将俄罗斯的炮击与西方盟国的援助延迟联系在一起，俄罗斯的炮击导致乌克兰数十万人停电，这是今年对能源基础设施造成的最严重的破坏性袭击。
item.description:
A Russian barrage left hundreds of thousands of people without power in Ukraine in the most damaging attack this year on energy infrastructure, which President Volodymyr Zelensky linked to delays in aid from Western allies https://t.co/ySoesKaupz https://t.co/ySoesKaupz

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 多年来，中国新一代中产阶级认为经济繁荣是理所当然的。他们日趋紧张的情绪可能会成为中国政府的一大难题。
item.description:
For years, China’s new generation of middle class were able to take a booming economy for granted. Their increasing nervousness could be a major problem for Beijing. https://t.co/pt4QFrDqhp https://t.co/pt4QFrDqhp

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: "要么你结束这一切，要么我走人"在华盛顿特区的一个富人区，一桩少棒丑闻让位高权重的家长们相互对立，并导致了一项发现。
item.description:
“Either you end this crap, or I’m walking.” A Little League scandal in a tony part of Washington, D.C., pits high-powered parents against one another—and leads to a discovery. https://t.co/jRC46Zq5iu https://t.co/jRC46Zq5iu

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: Compass 因被指控参与合谋抬高房地产佣金而达成 5750 万美元的和解协议
item.description:
Compass reached a $57.5 million settlement over allegations that it was part of a conspiracy to keep real-estate commissions high https://t.co/W1Wcxki4tA https://t.co/W1Wcxki4tA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 国务卿安东尼-布林肯抵达以色列，他和其他美国高级官员正在为以色列和哈马斯之间达成停火协议进行最新的努力。
item.description:
Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Israel, as he and other top U.S. officials made the latest bid to secure a cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas https://t.co/cZpH1eEZRI https://t.co/cZpH1eEZRI

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 奥克兰大学六年级学生杰克-高尔克（Jack Gohlke）是大学篮球队中三分球命中率最高的球员。周四晚上，他的这一做法收到了成效，在 NCAA 锦标赛中首次爆出大冷门。
item.description:
Oakland sixth-year senior Jack Gohlke shoots the highest rate of 3-pointers in college basketball. Thursday night, the approach paid off with the NCAA tournament’s first major upset. https://t.co/5MeHxFJ4sm https://t.co/5MeHxFJ4sm

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 大谷翔平在道奇队的首秀并不尽如人意。@JasonGay：关于这位明星球员的翻译卷入赌博的指控--以及随着各联盟继续拥抱博彩业，这意味着什么。
item.description:
This wasn’t the debut Shohei Ohtani imagined with the Dodgers. @JasonGay on the gambling allegations involving the star ballplayer’s interpreter—and what it means as leagues continue to embrace the business of betting. https://t.co/EmWRHdaAp2 https://t.co/EmWRHdaAp2

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 欧盟正计划对俄罗斯谷物征收关税，以遏制莫斯科的收入，并安抚对廉价农产品进口感到愤怒的欧洲农民。
item.description:
The EU is planning to impose tariffs on Russian grain, part of an effort to curb Moscow’s revenue and appease European farmers who are angry about imports of cheaper agricultural products https://t.co/eKuMkpncnP https://t.co/eKuMkpncnP

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 马丁-索瑞尔（Martin Sorrell）曾是广告业的猎手，通过收购将 WPP 打造成全球最大的广告公司。现在，他成了猎物，因为他的 S4 Capital 公司正在寻求并购。
item.description:
Martin Sorrell was the ad industry’s hunter, building WPP into the world’s largest advertising company through acquisitions. Now, he’s the prey, as his S4 Capital firm fields merger offers. https://t.co/58mkPf7UHT https://t.co/58mkPf7UHT

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: "我太年轻了，不适合变老"。人们不遗余力地减少或阻止白发苍苍的过程。一些研究衰老问题的科学家认为，他们可能有所发现。
item.description:
“I’m too young to be old.” People are going to great lengths to reduce or halt the graying process. Some scientists of aging think they might be onto something. https://t.co/VpSDESSmyD https://t.co/VpSDESSmyD

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 这款手袋具有香奈儿经典款式的所有特征：奢华的绗缝皮革、闪亮的金色配件、精致的缝线。但它却是一个毫无价值的赝品。
item.description:
The handbag had all the hallmarks of a classic Chanel: sumptuous quilted leather, sparkling gold hardware, delicate stitching. But it was a worthless fake. https://t.co/Yw1Mm9HTdA https://t.co/Yw1Mm9HTdA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 麦肯锡、波士顿咨询公司（BCG）和德勤（Deloitte）等老牌大型咨询公司受雇为全球最大的企业预测未来，但它们却弄错了自己的命运--其后果是一团糟
item.description:
Big and established consulting firms such as McKinsey, BCG and Deloitte, which are paid to predict the future for the world’s biggest corporations, have gotten their own destiny wrong—and the fallout is messy https://t.co/BdxWLPYmAU https://t.co/BdxWLPYmAU

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 街谈巷议：美联储有望在今年开始降息，但抵押贷款利率可能不会降得那么快
item.description:
Heard on the Street: The Fed is on track to start cutting interest rates this year, but mortgage rates might not fall as quickly https://t.co/EJUKR59IkZ https://t.co/EJUKR59IkZ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 越来越清楚的是，富裕国家的中央银行预计将在未来几个月内降低主要利率。但是，只有一个国家宣布在抑制通货膨胀的斗争中取得了胜利。
item.description:
It is increasingly clear that central banks in rich countries expect to lower their key interest rates over coming months. But only one has declared victory in the battle to tame inflation. https://t.co/aigeDK1KL5 https://t.co/aigeDK1KL5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 司法部一位高级官员表示，越来越多的公司选择自愿披露不当行为，而且披露的犯罪活动范围比以前更广
item.description:
More companies are choosing to voluntarily disclose misconduct and on a wider range of criminal activity than previously reported, according to a top Justice Department official https://t.co/pii34T3D9d https://t.co/pii34T3D9d

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 回顾：由传奇纪录片导演弗雷德里克-怀斯曼（Frederick Wiseman）执导的公共广播公司（PBS）沉浸式影片《Menus Plaisirs-Les Troisgros》聚焦于一家米其林三星法国餐厅的运营情况。
item.description:
Review: Directed by the legendary documentarian Frederick Wiseman, the immersive PBS film "Menus Plaisirs–Les Troisgros" focuses on the operations of a French restaurant with three Michelin stars https://t.co/fkWrBaagsr https://t.co/fkWrBaagsr

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 拜耳公司首席执行官比尔-安德森（Bill Anderson）扔掉了管理手册。他的想法是减少老板，减少规则。
item.description:
Bayer Chief Executive Bill Anderson is throwing out the management playbook. His idea: Fewer bosses, fewer rules. https://t.co/pThcSEDkjc https://t.co/pThcSEDkjc

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 街谈巷议移民推动了美国的经济发展，而日本和中国却因人口减少而陷入困境
item.description:
Heard on the Street: Immigration has given the U.S. an economic boost, while Japan and China struggle because of declining populations https://t.co/1LjP4ukGNe https://t.co/1LjP4ukGNe

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 历史表明，共和党总统提名人唐纳德-特朗普和股市是一个糟糕的组合。无论如何，他的一些最狂热的支持者都对他的最新交易跃跃欲试
item.description:
History indicates that Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump and the stock market are a poor combination. Some of his most ardent supporters are piling into his latest deal anyway https://t.co/8J4IIa8NLm https://t.co/8J4IIa8NLm

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）面临着法律纠纷和竞选资金严重枯竭的困境，到处都有现金问题。这位前总统最大的希望是：他的社交媒体公司可能会带来一笔意外之财。
item.description:
With his legal woes and severely depleted campaign war chest, Donald Trump has cash problems everywhere he looks. The former president's best hope: a possible windfall from his social-media company. https://t.co/3vLXXHaV4f https://t.co/3vLXXHaV4f

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 对于一些求职者来说，宠物可能会在面试过程中发挥意想不到的作用，或者成为新员工迅速离职的原因。
item.description:
For some job candidates, pets can play an unexpected role in the interview process—or become the reason for a new hire’s quick exit. https://t.co/swYq7jS9Hx https://t.co/swYq7jS9Hx

item.title: 亚马逊正重点关注新兴电子商务竞争对手特姆优和Shein，认为这两个新兴平台对其在线购物主导地位构成重大威胁
item.description:
Amazon is focusing on emerging e-commerce rivals Temu and Shein, viewing the newer platforms as significant threats to its online shopping dominance https://t.co/lVN43zhlLl https://t.co/lVN43zhlLl

item.title: 权力的游戏》的主创们正在着手制作他们的第一个 Netflix 项目。这一次，主角不再是龙和异鬼，而是脱水的尸体、复杂的物理学和外星人的入侵。
item.description:
The "Game of Thrones" creators are embarking on their first Netflix project. This time, instead of dragons and White Walkers, there are dehydrated bodies, complicated physics and an alien invasion. https://t.co/fhID3rt9Kh https://t.co/fhID3rt9Kh

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 多年来，苹果公司一直面临着对其流行设备严密控制的投诉--这正是司法部在其具有里程碑意义的诉讼中提出质疑的地方
item.description:
Apple has faced complaints for years about the tight control it maintains around its popular devices—exactly what the Justice Department is challenging in its landmark lawsuit https://t.co/eQwUHtwyxW https://t.co/eQwUHtwyxW

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 拉法的 100 多万居民--其中大部分来自加沙地带的其他地方--正在准备迎接以色列与哈马斯之间战争的最后一场决定性战役
item.description:
More than a million people in Rafah—most of them from other parts of the Gaza Strip—are bracing for the last decisive battle in the war between Israel and Hamas https://t.co/nMnnToyX0g https://t.co/nMnnToyX0g

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 中国对这个曾经充满活力的城市的控制日益加强，香港社会的任何角落都无法幸免。"当潜规则、不成文的规定越来越多时，人们感到迷茫，只能眼睁睁地看着，默默地接受"。
item.description:
No corner of Hong Kong’s society has been left untouched by China’s tightening grip on the once-vibrant city. “When there are more and more unspoken, unwritten rules, people feel lost and can only watch and silently accept.” https://t.co/Vv66v31dkX https://t.co/Vv66v31dkX

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024
